about_the_game:
On December 21st, 2028, a small multinational team embarks on a covert mission to infiltrate a high-security facility deep within the Japanese mountains. Their objective is to reclaim control of one of the world's last remaining weapons of mass destruction, seized by a military-turned-nationalistic terrorist group.

As the player, you will enter the mind of the mission's commanding officer, Robert Jenkins. You will supplant his thoughts, direct his actions, and dictate his dialogue, making critical decisions determining his fate. Jenkins is a real person living in a parallel universe, initially unaware of your presence in his mind. Each choice you make carries significant weight while his life and sanity hang in the balance.

Whispers from the Rift is a standalone prequel set fourteen years before the events of CONSORTIUM VR / Remastered (also available here on Steam). Prior knowledge of the Consortium universe is NOT required.



Robert Jenkins: The man you will be inhabiting. Jenkins, recommended by Colin Wheats, leads the mission. With a background in the Canadian military, he has worked intermittently for the Global Senate since the Wars. Despite feeling out of his depth, Jenkins is inexplicably drawn to this mission, even though he knows it could be suicide.

Colin Wheats: Supposedly an American-born, former Mi6 operative. He was usually found deep undercover during the Wars, but since then, he's made a home as the top Asia-Pacific specialist for the Global Senate. His ties to remaining military forces in the region give him a geopolitical advantage, leading to him spearheading this mission.

Eliska Soltz: Ex-Israeli Special Forces, specializing in recon and technological infiltration. Contracted by the Global Senate specifically for this mission and is the only member without any previous ties to the organization. She is known to be a little volatile at the best of times and is immediately suspicious of Jenkins' role in the mission.

Jiang Shi: The most mysterious team member, but also its most important. A Chinese national exiled from her homeland due to her involvement in a supposedly botched infiltration mission while working for the Global Senate. Jiang has intimate knowledge of the super-weapon in question and supposedly intends to disable it once and for all.

Philip Lancaster: On the surface, Lancaster is a political functionary who is, for all intents and purposes, the mission's wild card. Spy by nature, his true nationality is unknown, and the vast majority of information on his work has been redacted or buried. With his burly stature and happy-go-lucky personality, Lancaster has said that life is like a video game, meant to be played until all its secrets and achievements are discovered.



• 500,000+ word interactive novel with well over 100 global variables, creating a narrative that is directly informed by YOUR choices. Conceptually influenced by old-school D&D choose-your-own-adventure books.
​
• Over 200 unique endings await, including deaths, disconnects, successes and failures. Discover enough endings to unlock various canon time jumps, enabling you to continue influencing Jenkins' life in the years leading up to him joining the Consortium.
​
• When replaying, easily see what choices you previously made to allow for easier exploration of other narrative threads.

• Discover dozens of illustrations in the form of visual "brain scans" taken directly from Jenkins’ mind. No generative AI was used in the development of these images.

• Don’t like the results of a choice? Go back in time to any point in the past and change your commands to forge a new path.
​

content_descriptors.notes: Contains moderate language, crude humor, and may involve descriptions of violence and gore.

short_description: An original action/sci-fi interactive novel. ​Enter the mind of a black-ops team leader heading up an impossible mission in a parallel universe. Experience events in first-person and whisper commands that must be obeyed in real time.
